conbody.p: A pool is a graphical container in a workflow diagram that represents the activities of a participant in a business process. A participant can be a business entity or a user role.

A workflow diagram can contain multiple pools; each pool represents a separate participant and its activities within the business process. A pool, therefore, partitions a set of activities from other pools. The communication between pools is shown through Message Flows.

The first user task that is designed in a pool is assigned to a group of users based on participant properties. As long as one user task is accomplished by a user, all activities (user or service task) designed in the same pool are automatically assigned to the same user.
